projects.title: GAZO (Gelderse Aanpak Zonnevelden met Omgevingskwaliteit)
projects.description: The Province of Gelderland and Wageningen University & Research are joining forces for the GAZO project. Scientists from the University will help a number of initiatives in Gelderland to develop solar landscapes that combine different functions and improve spatial quality. Two PhD researchers are part of the research team.

contributors.headline: Program developer Solar Research Program bij Wageningen University & Research
Associate Professor Environmental Policy at Wageningen University, Lecturer / PI at AMS-Institute
PhD Researcher Landscape Architecture at WUR

projects.title: RuiKwa-LAB: Ruimtelijke Kwaliteit in Waterveiligheidsbeheer
projects.description: Het onderzoeksprogramma ‘RuimtelijkeKwaLiteit in wAterveiligheidsBeheer (RuiKwa-LAB)’ bestudeert wat ruimtelijke kwaliteit in waterveiligheidsbeer inhoudt en hoe ruimtelijke kwaliteit geborgd kan worden in de procesarchitectuur van waterveiligheidsprojecten. Het is een gemeenschappelijk onderzoeksprogramma van de Afdeling Planologie van de Faculteit Ruimtelijke Wetenschappen van de Rijksuniversiteit Groningen (RUG) en het cluster Landschapsarchitectuur en Ruimtelijke Planning van Wageningen Universiteit (WU). De twee universiteiten werken hierin nauw samen met partners uit de praktijk, van waterschappen tot advies- en ontwerpbureaus. Samen vormen deze partners een Learning Community om een continue uitwisseling tussen wetenschap en praktijk te garanderen. Het programma is via crowdfunding gefinancierd door de verschillende praktijkpartners.

contributors.headline: Full professor and Chair Holder Landscape Architecture
Associate Professor in Planning and Water at University of Groningen

projects.title: Energy Gardens NL (Energietuinen NL)
projects.description: The Dutch Natuur en Milieufederaties (NMF) asked Wageningen University to join their project team in the development (design and construction) of three ‘Energy Gardens’ in The Netherlands. The project is funded by the Nationale Postcode Loterij. With this project, NMF wants to combine large scale renewable energy generation with recreational, nature, and educational functions. A second aim is to show that this can be done in such a way that it adds to the spatial quality of the existing landscape. In the project, we are responsible for the research through design that will be conducted together with local stakeholders. The lead researcher and first contact person is Merel Enserink.

contributors.headline: PhD researcher Landscape Architecture at Wageningen University & Research

projects.title: Best-practice European Photovoltaic Parks: A comparative case study
projects.description: The objective of this research is to create an overview of the best-practice designed solar parks in Europe and identify the used spatial strategies. Our focus lies on ground-mounted solar parks where besides electricity generation, other functions and/or values are incorporated in the design, such as biodiversity, leisure, aesthetics etc. We aim to derive knowledge that will aid the future design of high-quality solar parks. This research is conducted in collaboration between the HDEL research group at the Amsterdam Academy of Architecture and the Landscape Architecture group of Wageningen University. The lead researcher and first contact person is Dirk Oudes.

projects.title: National Climate Agreement: Spatial research for Dutch Climate Agreement
projects.description: Together with other spatial researchers, we participated in the meetings for the National Climate Agreement and advised negotiators on questions with potential relevance for urban and rural landscapes. Together, we managed to put landscape quality on the agenda (in Dutch ruimtelijke kwaliteit) and raise awareness for the concept of energy landscape: observable landscapes that originate directly from the human development of energy resources (Pasqualetti & Stremke, 2018). The physical consequences of implementing energy transition in The Netherlands and beyond may vary from small-scale local interventions to larger and more dedicated, so-called entity energy landscapes. The National Climate Agreement has been signed in late 2019.

projects.title: National Perspective Energy and Space (NPER)
projects.description: Four design companies, Deltametropool and the NRGlab/Wageningen University are collaborating in a project that aims to inform the Dutch discourse about sustainable energy transition, from a spatial perspective. The National Energy Perspective project addresses the energy use of the entire Netherlands: heat (and cold), electricity and mobility. The consortium examines realistic potentials to reduce energy consumption and possible strategies to utilize wind, solar, biomass and geothermal energy as well as heat-cold storage. On the basis of this research, a number of critical measures and spatial interventions into the Dutch energy landscape will be synthesized, in line with international agreements, quantitative as well as qualitative considerations. Results will be published in Spring 2017. Project partners: HNS, POSAD, FABRIC, Studio Marco Vermeulen and Vereniging Deltametropool.
